definitions.definition: Any gold or silver coin issued by the French kings from Louis XIII to Louis XVI and bearing their image on the obverse side, particularly the gold louis d'ors , originally a French form of the Spanish doubloon but varying in value between 10 and 24 livres .
The louis d'or constitutionnel , a 24- livre gold coin issued by the First French Republic .
The franc germinal or napoleon , a similar gold coin issued by Napoleon and bearing his image on the obverse , worth 20 francs .

main_definition: ( historical numismatics ) Any gold or silver coin issued by the French kings from Louis XIII to Louis XVI and bearing their image on the obverse side, particularly the gold louis d'ors , originally a French form of the Spanish doubloon but varying in value between 10 and 24 livres .
secondary_definitions: ( historical numismatics ) The louis d'or constitutionnel , a 24- livre gold coin issued by the First French Republic .
( historical numismatics , informal ) The franc germinal or napoleon , a similar gold coin issued by Napoleon and bearing his image on the obverse , worth 20 francs .
